moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 Nd4 4. Nxd4 e: The starting position for every game.
moves.10. Qh5: Putting pressure on the Knight, and tying the Black Q to its defense [the threat is BxN PxB QxP winning a Pawn.]
moves.10... Qd6: Looking to clear the back row and quickly complete development.
moves.14. Nf3: Looking to capture the advanced Pawn.
moves.15... Bxc4: Oops. Black overlooked the fact his Q is now en prise.
moves.17. dxc4: ...but so was the Bishop. Black resigns.

opening: Ruy Lopez (C61), Bird's defence, Paulsen variation
